definitions.definition: a government formed by two or more political parties working together
definitions.sensetop: (in) coalition (with somebody)coalition between A and B

examples.text: The two parties have formed a coalition.
The coalition was/were in power for four years.
The two parties governed in coalition for four years.
They didn't rule out coalition with the Social Democrats.
a coalition between the Socialists and Communists
They formed a coalition with the Greens.
a coalition led by the Socialist Party
the biggest party in the government coalition

definitions.definition: a group formed by people from several different groups, especially political ones, agreeing to work together for a particular purpose

examples.text: The network is a global coalition of environmental and consumer groups.
a broad-based coalition of religious and community groups
A broad coalition of organizations criticized the government's plans.
The proposal has been backed by a broad coalition of prison reform groups.
an umbrella coalition of human rights organizations
a grand coalition of various environmental groups

wordOrigin: early 17th cent. (in the sense ‘fusion’): from medieval Latin coalitio(n-), from the verb coalescere ‘grow together’, from co- (from cum ‘with’) + alescere ‘grow up’. Usage in politics dates from the late 18th cent.
